lines.text: Do you provide substitutes?

[shocked]
No! This is a respectable firm!
[Dimple has mistakenly arrived at a strip club instead of an aviary]
What do you want?
Your birds, and I can't wait. Tell me, what sort are they?
What sort you like?
Blue tits.
Eh?
Have you got any?
No. No, this place is centrally heated.
You know it'll take ninety-nine years to clear up this dump.
Yeah, well, step by step. That's the method. Little by little.
Okay then, boss, where do we start?
Well, I reckon to make it easier for us to walk about, we ought to sweep the floor first.
I don't wish to interfere, but I'd have thought it'd be better to start cleaning at the top of the house.
Yes, quite right, I mean disturbed dust will only fall down and muck up what we've already cleaned up.
Ladies and gentlemen, may I submit, with the greatest of respect, and for the sake of efficient team working, that we all belt up!
Hear, hear!
Always the gent!
Ooh, ain't he common!
Let us put ourselves in the hands of Mister Handy and listen to what he says.
Well, I bow to the majority, of course, but I'd like it noted that I did suggest the suggestion I suggested.
And very suggestive it was, too!
Bet you this has something to do with atomic energy.
Oh gracious! I do hope you don't finish up in Russia!
Well if I do, Miss Cooling, I shall behave myself as an ex Corporal of the Pioneer Corps should. Name, rank, number and keep your hand off my shovel, and that's your lot.
Don't go! Think of brainwashing.

[chuckles]
How can they wash what isn't there?
[Lily is being fondled by an amorous actor whose hands are all over her]
I *like* Helping Hands.

[primly]
And I don't like "helping yourself" hands.
Windy stairckey up to the ceily, fine glinty scintillabe up the dangly chanderlabies...
